name: hrfs
short_description:
*High Reliability File System*

= Overview =

Hrfs is a stackable raid filesystem, which uses several lower directories to keep duplications of data in order to provide raid support for [http://www.lustre.org Lustre], ext4 or other filesystems in order to increase the avaliability and reliabilty of the storage systems. 

Hrfs is able to: 
 * Duplicate files and directories in several lower branches
 * Selfheal if any lower branch is broken
 * Apply different duplication policy according to file-name pattern
 * Support a series of lower filesystems, including local filesystems, network filesystems and cluster filesystems
 * Easily add support for new lower filesystems
 * Take full advantage of characteristic features of a specific lower filesystem
